revised_title: Inelastic Collisions Between Atoms: Theoretical Considerations
tldr: This article investigates the probability of slow inelastic collisions between atomic systems using the perturbed stationary state method. The authors extend the method to include resonance degeneracy and transitions involving a change in the axial component of angular momentum. They also compare the method with Born's approximation and discuss its scope and limitations. The article provides new semi-classical formulae suitable for numerical applications.
